For consular emergencies only on these dates, call +31 70 4270 262

Disabled access

The Foreign and Commonwealth Office, the British Embassy The Hague and the British Consulate General Amsterdam are keen to ensure that their buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations we will endeavour to provide a service or access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at the British Embassy The Hague. We hope this information is helpful.

British Embassy The Hague

  • entrances: all entrances are on the ground floor and are unobstructed
  • ramps: mobile ramps are available
  • lifts: there is lift accessibility to all floors apart from mezzanines
  • toilets: there is a disabled toilet on the first floor
  • parking: there are no parking facilities at the embassy, although payable public parking spaces can be found nearby
  • floor coverings: all floor coverings are safe and even
  • lighting: lighting in the building is good
  • emergency/evacuation: emergency alarms are loud and there is also a visual alarm; there is an evacuation chair for wheelchair users
  • phones: phones are available at wheelchair height

Access for visually impaired visitors or deaf/hard of hearing visitors

Guide and hearing dogs are welcome.

Contact us

If you need to visit us or use our services and feel that we are inaccessible to you, please contact corporate services, who will try to find an alternative way of providing access for you:

  • email: ukinnl@fco.gov.uk
  • telephone: +31 (0)70 4270 427

Opening hours

Documentary and notarial services by appointment only. Please use the contact form to book an appointment. Consular staff will not be able to book an appointment for you.

Open to the public:

Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday, 9am to 12:30pm

Consular telephone enquiries

Monday to Friday, 9am to 1pm and 2pm to 4:30pm

Disabled access

The Foreign and Commonwealth Office, the British Embassy The Hague and the British Consulate-General Amsterdam are keen to ensure that their buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations we will endeavour to provide a service or access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at the British Consulate-General Amsterdam. We hope this information is helpful.

General physical access

Access to the Consulate for wheelchairs is through the side entrance a few meters along the driveway into the rear carpark. Although there are no ramps, the ground surface is safe and secure. Inside the entrance to the former Consular waiting room, doors are wide enough for wheelchair access to the interview room. Please contact us on +31 (0)20 676 4343 if you are arriving by car and would like assistance on arrival. Our security guards and staff will be happy to help.

Access for visually impaired visitors or deaf/hard of hearing visitors

Guide and hearing dogs are welcome.

Opening hours

Monday, Tuesday, Thursday and Friday, 09:00 to 12:30.

To contact one of our Consular colleagues please call 0031 (0)20 676 4343 and follow the options for Consular Services.

We operate a 24/7 service for the most urgent cases.

Disabled access

The Foreign and Commonwealth Office and our Embassy are keen to ensure that their buildings and services are fully accessible to disabled members of the public. Wherever possible, we have made our buildings and services accessible. Sometimes however, this is not possible due to security or other restrictions. In these situations we will endeavour to provide a service or access to a building in an alternative way to ensure equality of access for disabled people. To assist disabled visitors, we have set out below details of disabled access at this Consulate General. We hope this information is helpful.

General physical access

Access to the Consulate for wheelchairs is through the side entrance a few meters along the driveway into the rear carpark. Although there are no ramps, the ground surface is safe and secure. Inside the entrance to the former Consular waiting room, doors are wide enough for wheelchair access to the interview room. Please contact us on +31 (0)20 676 4343 if you are arriving by car and would like assistance on arrival. Our security guards and staff will be happy to help.

Access for visually impaired visitors

Guide dogs are welcome.

Access for deaf and hard of hearing visitors

Hearing dogs are welcome.
